storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive real-time pop-up alerts for scheduling conflicts to act immediately

testCases.title: Verify pop-up alert displays on conflict detection
preconditions: User is logged into the scheduling system with Scheduler role
Pop-up alerts are enabled in user preferences
Conflict detection engine is active and running
At least one existing schedule entry exists in the system
User has necessary permissions to create/modify schedules

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling interface loads successfully with input fields visible

steps.action: Enter scheduling data that causes a conflict with an existing schedule (e.g., same resource, overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: Pop-up alert appears on screen within 1 second of entering the conflicting data

steps.action: Read the alert details displayed in the pop-up
steps.expectedResult: Alert shows accurate conflict information including conflicting items, times, resources, and clear description of the conflict

steps.action: Click the acknowledge button on the pop-up alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is dismissed from the screen and acknowledgment is recorded in the system

steps.action: Verify acknowledgment was recorded by checking system logs or audit trail
steps.expectedResult: System logs show the alert acknowledgment with timestamp and user information

postconditions: Pop-up alert is no longer visible on screen
Alert acknowledgment is recorded in system database
User remains on the scheduling interface
Conflicting schedule data is not saved until resolved

testCases.title: Test alert preference configuration
preconditions: User is logged into the scheduling system with Scheduler role
User has access to settings/preferences page
Pop-up alerts are currently enabled by default
At least one existing schedule entry exists to create conflicts
User preferences are stored and retrievable from database

steps.action: Navigate to user settings or preferences page
steps.expectedResult: Settings page loads successfully with alert preferences section visible

steps.action: Locate the pop-up alert configuration option
steps.expectedResult: Pop-up alert toggle or checkbox is visible and currently enabled

steps.action: Disable pop-up alerts by toggling off or unchecking the option
steps.expectedResult: Setting is updated and confirmation message appears indicating pop-up alerts are disabled

steps.action: Save the preference changes
steps.expectedResult: Settings are saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Navigate to scheduling interface and enter scheduling data causing a conflict
steps.expectedResult: No pop-up alert appears on screen despite the conflict being detected

steps.action: Return to user settings and enable pop-up alerts by toggling on or checking the option
steps.expectedResult: Setting is updated and confirmation message appears indicating pop-up alerts are enabled

steps.action: Save the preference changes
steps.expectedResult: Settings are saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Navigate to scheduling interface and enter scheduling data causing a conflict
steps.expectedResult: Pop-up alert appears on screen within 1 second displaying conflict details

postconditions: Pop-up alerts are enabled in user preferences
User preference settings are persisted in database
Alert behavior matches the configured preference
User remains logged into the system

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive email notifications for scheduling conflicts to stay informed when away from system

testCases.title: Verify email notification sent on conflict detection
preconditions: User is registered in the system with valid email address
Email notifications are enabled in user preferences
SMTP or email service is configured and operational
Conflict detection engine is active and running
At least one existing schedule entry exists in the system
Email delivery logging is enabled
Test email inbox is accessible for verification

steps.action: Note the current timestamp before triggering the conflict
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is recorded for measuring email delivery time

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict in the system by creating or modifying a schedule that conflicts with an existing entry
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected by the system and conflict detection logs show the event

steps.action: Wait and monitor for email notification delivery
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is sent within 30 seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Check the recipient's email inbox for the notification
steps.expectedResult: Email is received in inbox with subject line indicating scheduling conflict

steps.action: Open and read the email content
steps.expectedResult: Email contains accurate conflict details including conflicting items, times, resources, and affected schedules

steps.action: Review email delivery logs in the system
steps.expectedResult: Delivery status is logged as successful with timestamp, recipient email, and delivery confirmation

steps.action: Verify the email delivery time from logs
steps.expectedResult: Email was sent within 30 seconds of the conflict detection timestamp

postconditions: Email notification is successfully delivered to recipient
Email delivery is logged with successful status
Conflict remains in system until resolved
Email service remains operational for future notifications

testCases.title: Test email notification preference settings
preconditions: User is logged into the scheduling system with Scheduler role
User has access to settings/preferences page
Email notifications are currently enabled by default
User has valid email address registered in system
At least one existing schedule entry exists to create conflicts
Email service is configured and operational

steps.action: Navigate to user settings or preferences page
steps.expectedResult: Settings page loads successfully with notification preferences section visible

steps.action: Locate the email notification configuration option
steps.expectedResult: Email notification toggle or checkbox is visible and currently enabled

steps.action: Disable email notifications by toggling off or unchecking the option
steps.expectedResult: Setting is updated and confirmation message appears indicating email notifications are disabled

steps.action: Save the preference changes
steps.expectedResult: Settings are saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict in the system
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected by the system

steps.action: Wait 60 seconds and check email inbox
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received in the inbox

steps.action: Verify email delivery logs
steps.expectedResult: No email delivery attempt is logged for this conflict

steps.action: Return to user settings and enable email notifications by toggling on or checking the option
steps.expectedResult: Setting is updated and confirmation message appears indicating email notifications are enabled

steps.action: Save the preference changes
steps.expectedResult: Settings are saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Trigger another scheduling conflict in the system
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected by the system

steps.action: Wait up to 30 seconds and check email inbox
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received in inbox with conflict details

steps.action: Verify email delivery logs
steps.expectedResult: Email delivery is logged as successful for this conflict

postconditions: Email notifications are enabled in user preferences
User preference settings are persisted in database
Email notification behavior matches the configured preference
User remains logged into the system
Email service continues to function normally

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to log all scheduling conflicts and alerts for audit and analysis

testCases.title: Verify logging of scheduling conflicts
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Logging system is operational and accessible
Database has sufficient storage for logs
At least two appointments exist that can create a conflict
User has permissions to query system logs

steps.action: Create or trigger a scheduling conflict by attempting to book overlapping appointments for the same resource
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and prevents the double booking

steps.action: Verify conflict details are logged with complete metadata including conflict type, timestamp, user ID, affected resources, and appointment IDs
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is logged within 500 milliseconds with all required metadata fields populated accurately

steps.action: Navigate to the system log query interface and search for the conflict entry using the timestamp or conflict ID
steps.expectedResult: Log query returns results within 2 seconds

steps.action: Review the retrieved log entry and verify all metadata fields match the triggered conflict details
steps.expectedResult: Log entry is present, complete, and accurate with correct conflict type, time, user information, and affected resource details

postconditions: Conflict log entry is permanently stored in the database
Log entry is retrievable for future audit purposes
System remains in operational state
No data loss occurred during logging operation

testCases.title: Verify logging of alerts and acknowledgments
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Alert system is configured and operational
Logging system is functional
Test user account exists to receive alerts
Unauthorized test account exists for access control testing
A scheduling conflict scenario is ready to trigger

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict that generates an alert to the designated user
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict and generates an alert notification

steps.action: Verify the alert is sent to the user through the configured notification channel
steps.expectedResult: Alert is successfully delivered to the user and alert delivery is logged with timestamp, recipient, and alert content

steps.action: As the recipient user, acknowledge the received alert through the system interface
steps.expectedResult: System registers the acknowledgment and displays confirmation to the user

steps.action: Verify the user acknowledgment is logged with timestamp, user ID, and alert reference
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is logged within 500 milliseconds with complete metadata including acknowledgment time and user details

steps.action: Query the logs to retrieve both the alert delivery and acknowledgment entries
steps.expectedResult: Both log entries are present, accurate, and linked to the same alert event

steps.action: Log out and log in as an unauthorized user without log access permissions
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized user successfully logs into the system

steps.action: Attempt to access the system logs or query log entries as the unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message indicating insufficient permissions, and the access attempt is logged as a security event

postconditions: Alert delivery and acknowledgment are permanently logged
Logs are securely stored with proper access controls enforced
Unauthorized access attempt is logged for security audit
System maintains log integrity and security
All logging operations completed within performance requirements

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to provide detailed conflict information in alerts to understand and resolve issues quickly

testCases.title: Verify detailed conflict information in alerts
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Alert system is configured and operational
Multiple appointments exist in the system that can create conflicts
Resources are properly configured with names and availability
System performance monitoring tools are available to measure alert generation time
User has access to view scheduling details and navigate to conflicting schedules

steps.action: Create a scheduling scenario with multiple simultaneous conflicts by attempting to book three overlapping appointments for the same resource at the same time
steps.expectedResult: System detects multiple scheduling conflicts simultaneously

steps.action: Trigger the conflict detection and wait for the alert to be generated
steps.expectedResult: Alert is generated and displayed to the user

steps.action: Review the alert content and verify it includes full details of all conflicting appointments including appointment IDs, titles, times, and durations
steps.expectedResult: Alert displays complete information for all three conflicting appointments with accurate details

steps.action: Verify the alert includes resource names and time slots for each conflict
steps.expectedResult: Alert shows the resource name and specific time slots for each conflicting appointment clearly

steps.action: Identify and verify the presence of clickable links to each conflicting schedule in the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert contains distinct clickable links or buttons for each of the conflicting appointments

steps.action: Click on the first link in the alert to navigate to the first conflicting schedule
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the correct schedule page showing the first conflicting appointment details

steps.action: Return to the alert and click on the second link to navigate to the second conflicting schedule
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the correct schedule page showing the second conflicting appointment details

steps.action: Return to the alert and click on the third link to navigate to the third conflicting schedule
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the correct schedule page showing the third conflicting appointment details

steps.action: Using performance monitoring tools, measure the time elapsed between conflict detection and alert display
steps.expectedResult: Alert generation and display completes within 1 second of conflict detection, meeting the performance requirement

steps.action: Verify the alert remains accessible and all information is readable and properly formatted
steps.expectedResult: Alert displays all conflict information in a clear, organized, and user-friendly format with no truncation or formatting errors

postconditions: Alert with detailed conflict information is logged in the system
User has successfully navigated to all conflicting schedules
Conflicts remain unresolved and available for user action
System performance metrics confirm alert generation within 1 second
Alert can be dismissed or remains available for future reference per system design

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to configure my alert preferences to receive notifications via preferred channels

testCases.title: Verify alert preference configuration and application
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler with valid credentials
User has access to alert preference settings
User profile database is accessible and operational
At least one alert-triggering event is available for testing
Default alert preferences are set (all channels enabled)

steps.action: Navigate to the alert preference settings page from the main dashboard or user profile menu
steps.expectedResult: Alert preference settings UI is displayed showing all available alert channels (pop-ups, emails, dashboard notifications) with current configuration status

steps.action: Verify that all alert channel options are visible and accessible
steps.expectedResult: Pop-up notifications, email notifications, and dashboard notifications options are displayed with toggle switches or checkboxes in their current state

steps.action: Enable the email alert channel by clicking the toggle switch or checkbox
steps.expectedResult: Email alert channel toggle changes to enabled state with visual confirmation (e.g., green color, checkmark)

steps.action: Enable the dashboard notifications channel by clicking the toggle switch or checkbox
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard notifications channel toggle changes to enabled state with visual confirmation

steps.action: Disable the pop-up alert channel by clicking the toggle switch or checkbox
steps.expectedResult: Pop-up alert channel toggle changes to disabled state with visual confirmation (e.g., gray color, unchecked)

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Apply' button to save the alert preferences
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed confirming preferences are saved successfully, and the save operation completes within 1 second

steps.action: Refresh the alert preference settings page or navigate away and return to the settings
steps.expectedResult: Previously saved preferences are displayed correctly: email enabled, dashboard notifications enabled, pop-ups disabled

steps.action: Trigger an alert event that would normally generate notifications across all channels
steps.expectedResult: Alert is delivered only through enabled channels: email notification is received and dashboard notification appears

steps.action: Verify that no pop-up alert is displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: No pop-up notification appears, confirming that disabled channel preferences are respected

steps.action: Check the email inbox for the alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Email alert is received in the inbox with correct alert content and timestamp

steps.action: Check the dashboard notifications section
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard notification is visible in the notifications panel with correct alert content and timestamp

steps.action: Measure and verify the response time for preference retrieval
steps.expectedResult: Preference retrieval operation completes in under 1 second as per performance requirements

postconditions: User alert preferences are saved in the user profile database
Email and dashboard notification channels remain enabled
Pop-up notification channel remains disabled
Future alerts will be delivered according to the saved preferences
User session remains active and authenticated
